task_summary: Detect the red can, grasp it from the side, and raise it vertically off the table before briefly holding and retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed manipulator above a white tabletop must raise a small red can visible among bottles, cups, and caps. The tree first ensures perception of the can, computes a side grasp, approaches from above with a small alignment tolerance, executes the grasp, verifies stability, lifts the can by ten centimeters, holds briefly, and retreats. The scene shows a UR-type arm, the red can near left-center, with potential occlusions by nearby items. Motions are time-binned and forces unspecified; lifting distance is modest to avoid collisions with surrounding objects.
preconditions: Robot is homed and reachable workspace includes the red can
Table surface clear above the can for vertical lift
Camera view provides reliable detection of the red can
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and scan for the red can
Confirm visibility and detect precise pose
Compute grasp pose and verify blackboard availability
Move above target, align, and execute side grasp
Raise the held can by 0.10 m
success_criteria: Can is lifted off the table without collisions
Gripper holds can steadily for at least 1 s
Robot retreats to a safe clearance
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, rescan the area
If pose key missing, recompute grasp pose
If grasp unstable, reopen gripper, slightly realign, and retry
If lift meets resistance, stop and retreat to avoid collisions
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreating with the can successfully lifted and held for the specified duration

frame_3.now_evidence: arm close to target with alignment indicating imminent grasp
frame_3.predicts_next: grasp execution expected next with minimal lateral adjustment

node_specs.description: Prepare gripper for grasping by opening to 8 cm.
Search the workspace to localize the red can.
Verify the red can is currently visible to sensors.
Refine detection to obtain an accurate object pose.
Compute a side grasp pose for the cylindrical can and store it.
Ensure the computed grasp pose is on the blackboard.
Move to a pregrasp position above the can.
Descend and align with tight positional tolerance before grasp.
Execute the side grasp at the planned pose.
Confirm the can is firmly held.
Lift the grasped can by 10 cm.
Hold the can briefly to verify lift success.
Back off to a safe distance after lifting.

failure_modes: Collision with nearby objects while approaching or retreating
recovery_strategy: Recompute grasp pose and re-check availability
Open gripper, realign with tighter tolerance, retry grasp
Abort lift on contact, retreat slightly, and try a different approach angle
assumptions: Frames show a red can upright and reachable; instruction aligns with visuals
Side grasp is feasible with the seen parallel gripper
Exact yaw for approach is unspecified and handled by planner

expected_success_criteria: No collision events during approach and lift
